author: Skylar Woodhouse, Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump said that India has offered to cut all its tariffs on US goods but downplayed any sense of urgency to reach a trade agreement with the world’s fourth-largest economy.
title: Trump Says India Offered to Cut US Tariffs But He’s in No Rush

author: Sabrina Willmer, David Voreacos
description: A federal judge repeatedly expressed frustration Friday at the Trump administration’s failure to answer her questions about what it is doing to facilitate the return of a Maryland resident wrongly deported to a notorious prison in his native El Salvador.
title: Abrego Garcia Judge Frustrated at US Failure to Answer Questions

author: Akayla Gardner
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Returns to Washington Ready Deploy New Tariff Tactics

author: David Voreacos
description: President Donald Trump has been waging a campaign to pressure elite US colleges to make a wide range of policy changes, in what his administration has framed as an initiative to fight campus antisemitism and enforce civil rights protections.
title: Why Trump Is Targeting Harvard’s Funding and Tax-Exempt Status

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court blocked the Trump administration from using a wartime law to send a group of Venezuelans to a notorious Salvadoran prison, faulting the government for not giving the men adequate notice about its deportation plans.
title: Supreme Court Halts Trump’s Deportations of Venezuelans

author: Shruti Singh
description: Chicago is hiring Ernst & Young LLP to help the city slash costs and close budget gaps that are forecast to top $1 billion in each of the next two years.
title: Chicago Taps EY to Close $1 Billion Gap as Trump Threatens Funds

author: Marion Halftermeyer, Joe Deaux, Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump has put his plan to create a sovereign wealth fund on the back burner after three months of administration deliberations failed to offer the broad investment flexibility he seeks, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Trump Puts Wealth Fund on Back Burner as Ambitions Hit Limits

author: Teresa Xie, Steven T. Dennis
description: Attorneys for Donald Trump’s World Liberty Financial crypto project pushed back against claims about potential conflicts of interest raised by the Democratic head of a Senate investigative subcommittee.
title: Trump’s Crypto Project Pushes Back on Senate Inquiry

author: Lydia Beyoud
description: The five-person Commodity Futures Trading Commission will soon be down to just two members, after Commissioner Christy Goldsmith Romero announced plans to leave the agency at the end of the month.
title: CFTC to Dwindle to Two Members After Goldsmith Romero Departure

author: Alberto Nardelli, Alex Wickham, Natalia Drozdiak, Daryna Krasnolutska
description: European officials have no idea what President Donald Trump will say next about Russia’s war in Ukraine — or where that may leave them.
title: Europe Waits to Find Out Where Trump Swerves to Next on Russia

author: Natalia Ojewska
description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk’s push to undo eight years of populist rule faces a reckoning just as other parts of Europe struggle to contain rising support for more conservative, nationalist forces.
title: Poland’s Presidential Vote Puts Tusk’s Reform Agenda at Stake

author: Jan Bratanic
description: Slovenia and several NATO member states are seeking ways to expand the definition of defense spending as they attempt to meet US calls to allocate more funds on security, the nation’s prime minister said.
title: Slovenia Calls on NATO to Expand Its Defense Spending Definition

author: Emily Birnbaum, Jarrell Dillard, Tyler Kendall
description: A key House committee on Friday failed to advance House Republicans’ massive tax-and-spending bill after hard-line conservatives bucked President Donald Trump and blocked the bill over cost concerns.
title: Trump Tax Cuts Rejected by House Panel as GOP Hardliners Dig In

author: Leen Al-Rashdan
description: US President Donald Trump ended his tour of the Middle East’s wealthiest countries touting new investments totaling a claimed $3.6 trillion — though upon closer inspection many of the deals appear inflated or recycled.
title: Trump’s Aerospace Deals Were Big on Numbers and Slim on Details

author: Sam Dagher
description: At every stop on his just-ended tour, President Donald Trump’s words were music to the ears of his Saudi, Qatari and Emirati hosts.
title: Gulf States Embrace Trump’s New Vision of Middle East

author: Nick Wadhams
description: The former US ambassador to Ukraine said she resigned in protest over President Donald Trump’s handling of the conflict with Russia and that she could no longer stand by while he pressured the government in Kyiv.
title: Ex-US Envoy to Ukraine Says She Resigned to Protest Trump Policy

author: Oscar Medina, Andrea Jaramillo
description: President Gustavo Petro brushed off the US bid to block the financing of projects in Colombia being built by Chinese state companies as his administration moved to join a development bank backed by the Asian nation.
title: Petro Shrugs Off US Move to Defund Chinese Projects in Colombia

author: Emily Birnbaum, Tyler Kendall
description: President Donald Trump called on members of his party to unite behind his economic agenda in Congress, putting pressure on factions of lawmakers who are calling for last-minute changes to the legislation to drop their demands.
title: Trump Berates Republicans to ‘Stop Talking’, Pass Tax Cuts

author: Erik Larson
description: President Donald Trump is fighting to end automatic citizenship for children born to parents who are in the country unlawfully or on temporary visas, part of his broader crackdown on immigration and a change that would overturn more than a century of court precedent.
title: Can Trump Really End Birthright Citizenship?

author: Deana Kjuka, Kateryna Chursina
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy, French President Emmanuel Macron, UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer, German Chancellor Friedrich Merz and Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk spoke with US President Donald Trump on the phone, Zelenskiy’s spokesman said.
title: Zelenskiy, European Leaders Speak With Trump by Phone

author: Michal Kubala
description: The European Union is working on a new sanctions package that will target the Russian financial sector in the latest effort by Ukraine’s allies to place pressure on President Vladimir Putin to negotiate a peace deal to end the war.
title: EU Prepares New Sanctions to Squeeze Russia’s Financial Sector

author: Ben Bartenstein, Dinesh Nair, Alex Dooler
description: In a power circle dominated by Abu Dhabi’s ruling family, Marty Edelman stands out as a rare outsider with real influence.
title: Abu Dhabi’s ‘Man in Manhattan’ Is Key to Unlocking Trump Deals

author: Kate Sullivan, Patrick Sykes
description: President Donald Trump said the US had presented Iran with a proposal over Tehran’s nuclear ambitions and that the country’s negotiators needed to move soon on the offer as talks intensify.
title: Trump Says Iran Has US Nuclear Proposal, Must ‘Move Quickly’

author: Jordan Fabian, Neil Munshi
description: US President Donald Trump for the second time in a week accused South Africa of perpetrating a genocide against White people — without any proof —  just days before he is set to receive the country’s president, Cyril Ramaphosa, in the White House.
title: Trump Attacks South Africa Again, Days Before Ramaphosa Visits

author: Wojciech Moskwa
description: Support for Warsaw Mayor Rafal Trzaskowski declined in the latest opinion surveys published before Poland holds the first round of presidential elections on Sunday, signaling a closer race with the populist opposition.
title: Tusk Ally Slides in Polls Just Before Polish Presidential Ballot

author: Natalia Drozdiak, Daryna Krasnolutska, Selcan Hacaoglu
description: Russia and Ukraine began their first direct talks in more than three years in Turkey, amid US and European skepticism about prospects for a peace deal to end the war.
title: Russia, Ukraine Hold First Direct Peace Talks in Three Years

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski, Taylan Bilgic, Daryna Krasnolutska
description: Talks between delegations of Ukraine, Russia and Turkey started in Istanbul, according to live broadcast on Turkish TV channel TRT.
title: Russia, Ukraine, Turkey Delegations Hold Meeting in Istanbul

author: Galit Altstein, Ethan Bronner
description: President Donald Trump’s Middle East tour has left Israel apprehensive about a shift in US foreign policy from one rooted in security to a focus on commerce, especially massive arms sales to neighbors that don’t recognize the Jewish state.
title: Israel Alarmed by Trump’s Arms Sales and Deals With Gulf States

author: Yoshiaki Nohara, Soo-Hyang Choi, James Mayger
description: Trade chiefs from some of the world’s biggest economies including the US and China agreed to focus on reforming global trade rules, after reaching an unexpected agreement by ignoring one of their biggest points of difference: tariffs.
title: APEC Trade Ministers Agree Statement Without Mentioning Tariffs

author: Kate Sullivan
description: Donald Trump beamed from the passenger seat of a golf cart as Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman took the wheel and personally whisked the US president to a desert oasis dinner in an ancient city.
title: Gold Palaces, Jet Deals and McDonald’s: Trump at Home in Middle East

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: US Patience Running Thin on Ukraine Peace Bid

author: Gresa Kraja
description: Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic denied there was any snag in plans for Jared Kushner’s firm to build a luxury hotel and residences in Belgrade.
title: Trump Project Is Still on in Belgrade, Serbian President Says

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said he would set tariff rates for US trading partners “over the next two to three weeks,” saying his administration lacks the capacity to negotiate deals with all of its trading partners.
title: Trump Says US Will Set Tariff Rates for Other Nations in Weeks

author: Craig Stirling
description: The European Union’s exports to the US rocketed in the month before President Donald Trump unveiled his so-called “Liberation Day” trade war with the rest of the world.
title: EU Exports to US Shot Up Just Before Trump’s ‘Liberation Day’

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said he would meet Russian President Vladimir Putin “as soon as we can set it up,” foreclosing an immediate face-to-face encounter aimed at brokering an end to the war in Ukraine.
title: Trump Wants Putin Meeting ‘Soon’ as He Heads Home From Mideast

author: Rene Vollgraaff
description: The head of South Africa’s second-biggest political party said talks about the nation’s revamped budget “are going very, very well,” a signal that the coalition government is resolving differences that derailed the National Treasury’s previous tax and spending proposals.
title: Leader of South Africa’s DA Lauds New Budget as ‘Credible’

author: Joao Lima, Henrique Almeida
description: Incumbent PSD and opposition Socialists face off on Sunday in a tight election race
title: Portugal’s Dueling Parties Both Want More Chinese Investments

author: James Mayger, Matthew Malinowski
description: Chile is still expecting the US to drop all tariffs back to zero as set out in the two countries’ free-trade agreement, a senior official said, an appeal from a nation that remains vulnerable to any international downturn caused by higher duties.
title: Chile Trade Chief Still Hopeful US Will Cut Tariffs Back to Zero

author: Brendan Murray, Samson Ellis
description: A Latin term that used to be little-known outside the world of customs brokers has become the stuff of headlines this year. That’s thanks to a decision by US President Donald Trump to close a tariff loophole for “de minimis” merchandise from mainland China and Hong Kong from May 2.
title: What’s the De Minimis Tariff Loophole That Trump Closed?

author: Echo Wong, Denise Wee
description: A US Treasury delegation met with Hong Kong banks to warn them against facilitating Iran oil shipments to China in April, just a month before sanctioning nine non-bank entities in the city allegedly involved in such trades, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: US Treasury Warns Hong Kong Banks Over Funding Iran Oil Trades

author: Eltaf Najafizada
description: India’s foreign minister discussed last month’s deadly attack in Kashmir during his first conversation with Afghanistan’s Taliban-led government, as the two sides continue efforts to improve ties.
title: India’s Jaishankar Discusses Kashmir in First Call With Taliban

author: Lucy White
description: Recent changes to immigration policy won’t do anything for people who’ve been exploited while seeking jobs in the UK. But they may worsen the care-worker shortage.
title: UK Visa Scams Squeeze Millions From Would-Be Care Workers

author: Irina Vilcu, Andra Timu
description: Romania’s track record as a reliable supporter of the European project will be put to the test Sunday as an ultranationalist Donald Trump disciple contends for the presidency against a one-time math prodigy.
title: Romania’s Destiny Rides on Trump Follower Versus Math Prodigy

author: Khalid Qayum, Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: The ceasefire between Pakistan and India will be extended to May 18, a top official in Islamabad said, indicating the respite in fighting is holding after clashes this month brought the two nuclear-armed nations close to a full-blown war.
title: Pakistan Says Ceasefire With India to Be Extended to May 18 as Truce Holds

author: Cynthia Li, Yujing Liu, Iris Ouyang
description: Donald Trump’s tariffs on China will likely remain at a level expected to severely curtail Chinese exports to the US after the 90-day truce, analysts and investors say, suggesting Beijing may have to endure further economic pain despite active talks.
title: Trump’s China Tariffs Seen Staying at 30% Through Late 2025
